IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Related Reports: MSP unmarked vehicle D-24 is equipped with a mobile recording device. The incident was recorded by BWC. Vehicle Search Report 22-MSP-008428 (Submitted on Delta) Property Records PH #334639 Vehicle Storage Report MVI# N/A Civil Citation# 0Z40661299 Scene processing The recovered CDS was captioned on MSP Form 63 (Property Record PH #334639), MSP Form 67 (Request for Laboratory Examination and Chain of Custody was marked N/A), and stored according to MSP policy and procedure. The CDS will be destroyed in accordance with MSP policy. Copies of civil citations and MSP forms are attached to the case file. Physical evidence Item A: One baggie containing suspected Marijuana. Weight: 13.2 grams (PH #334639) Suspects/Defendants: Wolfe, Madison Rylie (W/M, 03/19/2002 3628 Valley Ter Apt-A9, Windsor Mill, MD 21244 Maryland Soundex W-410-571-755-207 NARRATIVE On March 07, 2023, at approximately 1301 hours, I, Trooper First Class Reckeweg #7214 of the Maryland State Police currently assigned to the Bel Air Barrack (Unmarked MSP patrol vehicle D-24) was stopped at the red traffic light on eastbound Route 40 and Route 152, Edgewood Road, Harford County. At this time, I observed a gray Dodge sedan traveling in lane one (1) on southbound route 152 and route 40. I then observed the driver of the gray Dodge was not restrained by his seatbelt. I pulled behind the Dodge, and a traffic stop was initiated as I activated my emergency equipment. The Dodge stopped completely outside of 713 Magnolia, Joppa, Maryland. I then observed the Dodge bearing Maryland registration 2EN8315. I approached the Dodge on the drivers side window, made contact with the driver, and advised the reason for the traffic stop. I then asked the driver for his drivers license and registration. The driver was identified as Hollis, Anthony Maurice (B/M DOB 06/27/1999, Maryland Soundex H-420-067-590-502) by his Maryland drivers license. I observed a front passenger, who I later identified as Wolfe, Madison Rylie (W/F, DOB 03/19/2002, Maryland Soundex W-410-571-755-207) by her Maryland drivers license. I immediately detected the strong odor of raw and burnt Marijuana emitting from the interior of the Dodge. I asked Hollis if anyone was smoking Marijuana inside the Dodge which he replied not. Once additional units arrived to assist with the search, I asked Hollis and Wolfe to exit the Dodge and walk to the front of my patrol vehicle. At the front of my patrol vehicle, Wolfe advised that she had Marijuana in her person. Wolfe then removed two small clear plastic baggies from her black purse (The Marijuana was not properly packaged or labeled with her name) containing a measured amount (13.2 grams) of greenish-brown vegetable matter which I identified through my training, knowledge, and experience as Marijuana. Wolfe advised that she does not possess a medical marijuana card. A probable cause search based on the odor of Marijuana was conducted. No other contraband or controlled dangerous substance was recovered at this time. The recovered CDS was identified based on my training knowledge and experience as a Maryland State Trooper and previous drug arrests. Wolfe received a civil Citation for did possess a controlled dangerous substance of schedule (I) wit marijuana in an amount of less than 10. grams. The suspected Marijuana was taken to the Maryland State Police Bel Air Barrack for processing. The CDS was documented on MSP Property Record PH#334639. The CDS marijuana was weighed/verified by Sergeant Sander #5948. The Marijuana was sent for destruction per MSP policy and procedure Wolfe was given copies of all pertinent paperwork and was released on the scene. All events occurred in Harford County, Maryland.
